website_summaries.verdict: A basic drafting chair that will fit in small spaces.
pros: Combines the best features of a regular office chair with the benefits of extra height
Budget-friendly compared to other drafting chair options
Comes in different versions including one with support arms
cons: The armless version fails to provide support if sitting for a long time

customer_reviews.title: Excellent chair with great quality
customer_reviews.text: I recently redid my sewing room with counter-height work stations. I needed a high stool that was comfortable, has good back support, and doesn't have arms. This stool is perfect. I've been using it for a few months and have no complaints. The wheels roll very well. Assembly was a breeze. I love the foot rest. The back is positioned in exactly the right place for me. The seat is very comfortable--even when I sit for long periods. It's also the perfect height for my counter-height work area.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! I needed a chair that was higher than ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I needed a chair that was higher than most office chairs. And this was it! Perfect! Love the height on it. It's smaller, and will fit in smaller spaces, which is what I needed. The back is padded, so no worries about walls. Strong and sturdy. I am a plus size gal, and it holds up, no problem! Very stable. I have gotten stuck, rolling from floor to rug, and no tipping.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Healon

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this chair! I do a lot of crafting and also transcribing, so I needed a comfy chair to sit in for long periods of time. I also needed it to be tall since I have a tall work table. This chair fits both of those bills. I had been using a wooden bar stool for the longest time and this has been a God send. This chair is so comfortable, even after sitting in it for hours. Its very well made, sturdy and its looks really nice. I would HIGHLY recommend. If I ever need another one I would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: This is really high but otherwise a good buy.
customer_reviews.text: This is really high! Having the foot grid in there adds several inches - so much so that I couldn't get my knees under my desk. (Maybe it says that in the description, but I missed it.) However, that section is easy to remove, and I can put my feet on the wheel rests. The arm rests are very adjustable and sturdy. The seat and back-rest are comfortable. The fabric seems like it will last. It was easy to put together and was delivered on time. It's now working quite well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Just Sayin'

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, easy to assemble, and great to use as a mobility aid in the kitchen as I recover from an ankle injury that requires me to stay off of my feet for long periods of time. The height is tall enough to work comfortably at the kitchen counters, and the wheels roll easily on our tile floors without any issue. The width is slimmer than most desk chairs (mostly b/c there are no arms), and has a 360 degree swivel. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair. Fairly easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Nice chair. Fairly easy to assemble, just follow pictures. Comfortable seat. Easy to adjust. Bought this for counter height cutting table in my sewing room. I wanted one without arms and so far, this is exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: Completely satisfied with this chair.
customer_reviews.text: Completely satisfied with this chair. It is comfortable for a drafting chair. The seat height, when fully extended is 30.5". The foot rest ring is sturdy. Note that the assembly instructions sent with the chair did not include the seat height extension. Although it's easy enough to figure out. Apparently, they sell this same chair, without the seat height extension, for a typical desk height. Update Jun 2019: I have been using this chair 5 days a week for the past 14 months and have not had any problem with it. It still holds its 30.5" raised position and the seat and back covers show no wear. Completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my standing desk!
customer_reviews.text: I got this chair for my new standing desk and it's perfect. It was super easy to assemble and is the right height when I switch from standing to sitting. I bought a cheap chair cover on Amazon to give to some personality. I am 5'6", 117lbs and I noticed that the seat stops a little sooner than I'd like underneath me, but when using the footstool it fixes the issue. If you have a larger behind though it might be a little too short. Overall I am in love with it! It supports my back and feels great.
customer_reviews.author: Erin McDermott

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful chair!
customer_reviews.text: My particular chair's lowest setting is a little too high for my sewing desk, but I'm adjusting to it. The high setting puts me in the rafters! I have checked the measurements with the ones posted and mine are a little higher. However with that said, the chair is excellent quality, the most comfortable chair I've ever had, and (after getting used to the heighth) it works exactly for the purpose I purchased it. I would highly recommend this chair.
customer_reviews.author: shopwife

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: I created a standing desk. It's perfect. Only, who wants to stand ALL day? I sometimes put in 12 hours. It's very tiring. So I looked for a drafting stool with foot rest. Found this. Putting it together was very, very, very easy. And so far, it's working great. Easy to adjust for my height and foot ring circumference is wide enough to suit me.
customer_reviews.author: C. Allen

customer_reviews.title: The foot rest was missing
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these chairs and put together the first one right away. I didn't need the second one immediately so left it in the box. I ended up in the hospital and my family went to put the second chair together and found the circular foot rest missing. Unfortunately, I was diagnosed with a very rare and aggressive terminal cancer and the weeks got away from us. Now I'm past the return date with a chair that doesn't even fit together without that part. I love my one chair, but feel a bit ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: MaughaTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Legs dangle or knees lift at uncomfortable level due to footring placement...even if you are short to medium height.
customer_reviews.text: This chair isn't designed to be versatile, right down to the foot-ring: the ring itself doesn't allow height adjustment. I'm 5 ft 9.5" and my legs dangle at the lowest setting. The highest seat-level is too tall for my very high table and the only way the foot-ring height makes sense, Easy to put together and poorly designed. Beware of other "brands" with the same construction. Waste of time and money...designed for easy assembly and not consumer use.
customer_reviews.author: TLH

customer_reviews.title: This chair is a waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this chair about a year I have actually used is for about 50 hours! It is a piece of junk! It is uncomfortable, the back does not adjust more than one inch back and forth and the other day the hydraulic piston broke! I sit on the chair and it goes all they way down. I can’t adjust the height at all. I may be the exception, but damn it when you purchase something you expect it to function and not break down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You do get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Seat cushion is nill. My butt hurts after 15 minutes. Purchased for my studio, and I can't "add" to the seat because it is the single tallest drafting chair I have ever had at the lowest level. Anything added would place me over my drafting table height. I am in my late 60's and have purchased similar chairs, even cheaper ones in the last 45 years and this is the first one that I can say is a disappointment. Sorry but it is the truth.
customer_reviews.author: G. Allen

customer_reviews.title: I hate this chair
customer_reviews.text: The chair is something I bought and just set up in my office a week and a half ago. In that time, I've noticed that the chair arm bolts have repeatedly fallen out, the chair doesn't go low enough to let your feet rest on the floor (I'm 5'11), even if i take the bottom wheels off. It's just too high. Far higher than the description said it was. It also is wobbly and the arms constantly shift because the bolts fall out. It's too late to return the chair by about a week and a half. Stupid me for not assembling it right away. :(
customer_reviews.author: Kristiecsu

customer_reviews.title: Suggest you do not buy this chair
customer_reviews.text: This is my fifth drafting chair and by far the worst experience Minimal instructions in the package were for a different chair; not enough hardware to fasten the seat and seat back After getting the hardware from ACE, the chair is extremely uncomfortable The seat hits the back of the thighs in a strange way and numbs the legs The seat back is not straight and tilts towards the left It will be a hassle to take apart and send back as box is big and heavy; but cannot use this chair
customer_reviews.author: American Express

customer_reviews.title: A decent chair for the money
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, sturdy. It's not super cushy, but it's basically comfortable. It moves up and down easily. Good support. It's a good looking chair that I sit in several hours a week for work at home. I swap out with a wobble chair for fun.id buy another one if I need it.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Chairs are fine, packing was poor at best
customer_reviews.text: The chair looks good and will work for what we want for our theatre. The two stars is from the packaging ( or lack of packaging) that the product came in. One of the boxes was fine, but the other was ripped, a portion of the chair was scratched and chipped. The parts in the box looked as if they had been tossed in without care. My biggest issue with these chairs is that they require assembly, but there are no tools included in the kit to help you. It's a major annoyance when assembling a chair and finding out you need something that isn't included with the kit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: At first I loved it...
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved this chair, but I'm now on my 3rd... the first one won't stay up (after about 6 months to a year, no matter what, you can put it up when no load, but once any weight is put on it, it goes down). The second won't stay down. If you sit on it, it goes down, but immediately goes to max height if you get off it. The 3rd, just had a wheel break. Sigh. This one was only owned for about 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Soooo comfy, and perfect for why I purchased it.
customer_reviews.text: This chair was put together by my grandson in about 10 minutes. So far, it is comfortable and sturdy and feels far more stable than I could have hoped for. It's a kitchen work chair for someone who has to rest her legs frequently to avoid dire consequences, and even though I have only used it for a couple days so far, I feel that my money was quite well spent; if I get even a year of use from it, I will be completely satisfied; however, I have a feeling that there is more durability than that here if treated properly and not abused.
customer_reviews.author: Julie B.

customer_reviews.title: Good chair
customer_reviews.text: While working from home every other week, I had no real desk, so at my counter-height kitchen table I have been for months while at home. Turns out my chairs were not nearly as comfortable for an all-day sit. I chose this one as it looked comfortable and would adjust to the height I need. I also liked the fact that the foot bar was adjustable. I am a short person and it is very handy. I cannot say anything about putting it together as my husband was nice enough to do it for me. This chair has been better for my back and backside. (even my cat likes it)
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Williams

customer_reviews.title: O.K. Chair for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second chair of this type. Generally pleased with the chair although it gets minimal use for only 3 months of the year and no use the other 8 months. The reason I knocked it down in ratings is because it came missing some screws and having to many of another size. After searching I eventually found the size I was shorted on. Frustrating once you start the assembly process and then discover you can not finish the job.
customer_reviews.author: Henry A. Schafer

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the money
customer_reviews.text: Model: B1616-BY UPC: 751118161649 Height was exactly why I bought this one. Get your tape measure and verify before ordering. Machining could be nicer and more assuring. The wrong model number was on the outer box and the assembly sheet, still was an easy one to assemble. The great thing is that you can revert this to a standard height by removing the foot rest.
customer_reviews.author: mxn290

customer_reviews.title: Caveat Emptor
customer_reviews.text: Let the buyer beware. Parts do not fit together. Arm rests are wobbly. The seat tilts forward at an uncomfortable angle. What was I expecting at this price? After some shims and modifications it works, but not worth the effort. I threw away the arm rests.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Rowe

customer_reviews.title: No support and very wobbly
customer_reviews.text: This chair is cheaply made and wobbles no matter what we tried to do. Would have sent this back but I had already put the boxes in the recycle bin and it rained on them. Good thing this is only used for a four-year old to do crafts with grandma. Would not recommend this chair to anyone. Also, the instructions are horrible and even when I figured it out myself, the instructions were wrong and missed an entire step.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Eldred

customer_reviews.title: Dimensions are way off for desk AND/OR drafting
customer_reviews.text: The chair did not conform to the dimensions as described. It was too high to be used as a desk chair (purpose for which it was bought) AND also too high to be used as a drafting chair (we have a drafting table).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well if you are a tall person
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to get a bit extra height to type on my desk keyboard, as a 5'5" person. The issue is when it is brought down to near or on the lowest point, you can't take advantage of the ring to place your feet on. So unless you are at least 5'6' without shoes, your feet will just dangle off the floor without support. There is no ring height adjustment like other models. Otherwise, it goes together rather easily and appears sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: TheTechGuy

customer_reviews.title: Just okay...not very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I found this chair cumbersome to assemble. I have three flimsy plastic cylindrical shaped pieces left over that weren’t shown in the instructions. As I’m looking at the pictures on Amazon I see where they are added on the lift section of the chair. I don’t know what purpose they serve as they’re not sturdy. The chair is supportive and comfortable but feels a little wobbly. It will serve my purposes for use in an art studio. If you are looking for something very sturdy find a higher quality chair.
customer_reviews.author: Wfran

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: If you're anything like me, assembling furniture is the worst! Luckily this was actually fairly easy and not headache inducing as long as you follow the instructions. The chair is lovely, with good back support and it easily fits a standing desk in height. No arms means you can just hop off it whenever you need to, and it's adjustable for both back piece and height. I recommend getting this if you need a relatively inexpensive yet not cheaply made standing desk chair.
customer_reviews.author: Danni

customer_reviews.title: do not buy if you like your ass the way it is.....
customer_reviews.text: if you want 4 screws going up your asss cheeks then buy this..... the bottom 4 screws that go into the chair stick out a lot and you pretty much are sitting on 4 screws rubbing against your ass bones..... this some bs... i only sat in it for 3 days and my legs hurt from the screws rubbing on my ass bones...... all bad!
customer_reviews.author: Miguel l.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I am short and would have liked to be able to lower the chair a little more. My goal was to find a chair that would work with an adjustable standing desk that I already owned. The lowest setting for the chair is higher than the lowest setting for the desk. With tweaking, all is well. I am happy also with the sturdy, comfortable construction.
customer_reviews.author: P. Wilbur

customer_reviews.title: Footrest too high for a short person
customer_reviews.text: I like this chair. It is well-made. But I gave it only three stars for two reasons: The assembly instructions were difficult to follow and the foot rest is too high above the legs. I'm 5' 3" and have the chair seat in it's lowest position. Footrest is probably OK is you have the seat set higher. I couldn't figure out how to make the footrest be any lower so I'm living with this issue, but that keeps the chair from being perfect for me. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Seattlegal

customer_reviews.title: it became unstuck and easily lowered down to 25"
customer_reviews.text: Comfy chair with seat height at 25 inches with knees below the hips. ....At setting up I raised the seat it to its highest point (30") and had a problem lowering it. The leveler was stuck in place. Later in the day, after wiggling the leveler, it became unstuck and easily lowered down to 25". The seat is 18" across and 16" deep. It would have been ideal if the seat was 18" deep for a tall person
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great chair -but, Need help in lowering the chair
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drafting chair. Well made and easy to assemble. Only problem is that it was too tall for my desk and I have thrown away the boxes to return it. Does anyone know how to remove the round foot rest to lower it a couple of inches? I removed the casters and the chair still needs to be a bit lower. Has anyone removed the foot rest? Is it even possible?
customer_reviews.author: JA12

customer_reviews.title: Great Chairs! Five Stars!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for employees to sit in while soldering at their workbenches. So far they have worked out great! They are super comfortable and they adjust to a perfect height for optimum comfort while doing bench work. Just be careful not to let it roll out from under you as you are starting to sit down in it. I made that mistake and my brain quickly learned to grab hold of the chair when sitting down on it. For the price these are great chairs!
customer_reviews.author: ThatOneGuy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this chair after reading several reviews on other chairs. This chair so far has proven to be easy to assemble, only screwdriver required, and it took less than 10 min to assemble. It is very comfortable. Working from home required me to have a chair that I can easily move around and get out of, as well as be tall enough to fit my tall desk. Good chair.
customer_reviews.author: omshantiom

customer_reviews.title: check height
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think to check the height on the chair and how it would fit my current desk. At the lowest setting it is about 2.5" below my desk. I am a petite woman (4'11") and have been having a lot of neck and shoulder pain with my arms being extended to reach my mouse for long periods of time with my previous chair. Having a higher chair helps keep my arms closer to my body. This chair definitely helps with that but my legs are pinched between my chair and desk which doesn't really bother me. Overall I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & Sits Very High
customer_reviews.text: Chair was very easy to assemble, but compared to my previous drafting chair this one does not lower as much so caused an issue with side arms not able to slide under my table. Other than that, I love this chair.
customer_reviews.author: 1hubbarda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Compliment for Stand-Up Desk
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect compliment for my stand-up desk. I have been on the hunt for something like this for a while so that I don’t have to raise and lower the desk throughout the day. The stool is the perfect height and the foot ring is a must. This stool was super affordable too. The back support could be a bit better but I don’t plan to sit in it all day so it actually works out fine since it encourages me to change positions. This stool is a must for stand-up desk users!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Owens

customer_reviews.title: Great chair, affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: Like many families this fall (2020), our kids are being educated remotely. We had a great place for our high school daughter to sit to do her work, but needed a taller chair to make it comfortable for her. We bought the version with arms at her request. When it arrived, she assembled in herself and has been using it for a few weeks now. She says it's very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: InteriorGirl

customer_reviews.title: Stem for chair back is too short
customer_reviews.text: I have a standard height version of this chair which is great. The drafting height version has a shorter stem for the back. This means that there is not enough space to sit properly and you feel like your being pushed off the chair. Thankfully this chair was replacing another that was old and had lost its padding. I took the back off my old chair but this is a product failure that needs to be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Kate's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair, cheap wheels
customer_reviews.text: Delivery on time, packing not damaged, assembly very easy. After assembly went to move the chair by picking it up and one of the wheels fell completely apart so I can't say what the comfort is as I haven't even been able to sit in it. I guess I'll try to find a better set of wheels. Very disappointed as I have a specific job for this chair and now Ill be delayed further.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Y.

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: Better than not having an office chair, but I've had it for three months and it kind of feels like it's falling apart. The seat is completely squashed as well as now tipping in one direction. (I'd also like to add that I'm only 120lbs, so I feel comfortable blaming the chair for squashing too easily rather than my body's own interaction with gravity) What I also didn't notice before I bought it is that the back is absolutely straight up and down which is currently causing me a lot of pain. I had kind of hoped to get more than three months of life out of this chair :/ I wouldn't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: FishwifeWrites

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together and is sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and is sturdy. I've had to tighten the seat screws some because of use, but that takes care of any wobbles. I use this with my VariDesk and can easily change seat height when needed. I also tend to leave it at the tall height so that I can sit even when my VariDesk is at standing level.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer in Kentucky

customer_reviews.title: Soft, swivels, smooth!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my elementary school classroom. I chose the armless model so I can play guitar easily. The swivel and rolling are smooth. The seat is really comfortable. If I could change one thing, it would be for it to adjust to a lower height. At its lowest, it is still above normal adult desk height, but I use it at a higher computer cart anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High chair
customer_reviews.text: I had to purchase an adjustable table so that I wouldn't have to bend down to craft or sew. I purchased this chair and it's a bit higher than expected when it's at it's lowest setting but I love that the chair is a high chair and is adjustable. The seat is pretty comfy. I don't really lean back so can't comment on the back support or total comfort of the chair. However, it works great for my intended use. I recommend this product if you need a "high chair."
customer_reviews.author: Summer T

customer_reviews.title: My table/desk and chair  :-)
customer_reviews.text: I love this chair for my living room. I sit at it for my PC and to eat at. The chair is adjustable to a comfortable height so I can surf the web and eat at my desk/table set up.
customer_reviews.author: Tamika

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy chair for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm a teacher and have had this for two school years. The adjustable height broke after 16 months so it goes up everytime I stand up then slides back down when I sit in it. A couple of the bolts have fallen out so I tighten them periodically. I'm upgrading to a mesh drafting chair for next year. Overall it's held up well to the abuse my 7th graders put it through when the earn sitting in my chair for the day!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany S.

customer_reviews.title: Good chair for price, easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: The seat is a little small (not very wide), but comfortable. It went together easily per easy to follow instructions, though one screw (out of four) under the seat could not be fully screwed in. We're using this as an extra chair in a tight spot, not really intended for extensive use, so I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona Cats

customer_reviews.title: Seat running higher than my regular desk height
customer_reviews.text: Received black, ordered gray. Instruction sheet provided is for a different type of chair which has arms and no leg-rest. So i have no idea how to install the leg rest on it. I put it inbetween where it made sense to me. Now my chair is taller than my desk. Should i use this with bar tabel or study tabel? Not happening.. this is going back from where it came. Bye bye junk.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie Monster

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy chair at a great height
customer_reviews.text: Max height 31", perfect for tall standing desks. The chair itself is a standard height office chair, but they send you a spacer to covert it into a tall drafting chair. Be sure to dig through all the parts when unpackaging to find the spacer, or else youll be very disappointed by your standard height chair (speaking from experience).
customer_reviews.author: Debo

customer_reviews.title: Works good even for a Big Boy...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Boss Drafting stool with adjustable arms and a foot ring over a year ago. I'm a 6 foot tall, 250 pound man and spend well over two hours a day in this chair. I like it! It was easy to assemble; all the parts needed were in place and directions clear. Before the purchase I looked at a lot of similar stools and even this one is rated for a person below my body weight, but over a year later and I've no regrets in purchasing it. Checking back in Dec, 2015 - I've had the stool for over three years and it is still working perfectly. No problems. Yes, I'd purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Foster Fanning

customer_reviews.title: Not for the normal femur-ed
customer_reviews.text: If you are more than 170cm, I can’t see how this would work. The seat is not deep enough to rest on, and the back pushes you off the front edge even at its most relaxed setting. If you have something in front of you to rest your feet on, that will help, but don’t think you can sit in the middle of a room and play a guitar on this. It is insanely cheap, though! Might be good for kids?
customer_reviews.author: K. Macleod

customer_reviews.title: Good chair for the price
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a chair that was higher and this was perfect for what I needed. Putting it together was a relatively easy just took a tiny bit of time by myself. Maybe 15 minutes or so. I got the ring arms, which I noticed feel like they might break when I put pressure on them when I sit down so I try to avoid leaning on them other than as an armrest. But otherwise everything is good so far!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M.

customer_reviews.title: Wrong hardware included
customer_reviews.text: We ordered 2 or these and one of them ended up having 2 sets of the arms rest mount screws instead of the hydraulic seat mount screws which are a different size. They were Metric so they cost me ~$5 at ACE to buy myself. I can't imagine how this happened seeing that all the mounting hardware is sealed in plastic in a cardboard sheet.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A.

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good but broke
customer_reviews.text: This chair looks good but broke after only two months.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: A good quality chair and at a good price
customer_reviews.text: this is my second purchase. the first one lasted for a year and a half. A good quality chair and at a good price. this time i am putting a chair cover over it so the surface doesn't rip off easily.
customer_reviews.author: shao c.

customer_reviews.title: OK CHAIR IF IT WORKED !
customer_reviews.text: i really think the seller sold me a chair that was returned ! it came in a used box and the gas lifting piston let the chair up one time and it stopped working !! now the parts are stuck together and i can't fit it back in the box to return it !! the seller has granted me a return but now i have no way to box it up for ups to ship it !! the box it came in should have been a red flag !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: DAVID MALONE

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Assemble, comfortable, inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are more specific to the chair version, not the drafting chair/stool version. It's missing steps on putting on the foot rail. But it was straightforward enough to figure out how to assemble. It was easy to put together and everything works well on it. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Stell

customer_reviews.title: Great chair, no issues at all
customer_reviews.text: This stool is a great addition to a working assembly area such as ours. We have 1 or 2 per 8' table. The height adjustment is perfect, not way too high or way too low. The chairs are simple to assemble and are so much less expensive than a major office supply store wants for about the same thing. Will buy more as we grow. Great product, great price.
customer_reviews.author: NCBirdman

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable and cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: The pneumatics broke after two months of lite use. Chair would become painful to sit in after about twenty minutes
customer_reviews.author: hryder77

customer_reviews.title: Foot ring is too high & does not appear to be adjustable
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice enough chair, but I cannot use it unless someone can tell me how to adjust the foot ring to a lower position. I wanted a replacement for a drafting chair that I got in 2012 & thought this was the same. I like to sit up high & rest my heels on the foot ring, but on this chair when I do that, my knees are up above my seat.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Crouch

customer_reviews.title: Great Workbench Chair
customer_reviews.text: The chair is exactly what i was expecting. It is a standard office chair with an extra attachment at the base, that adds the foot ring and some height to the chair. Its comfortable for about 2 hours and then some readjusting is needed, which is expected with a cheap chair.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good chair
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice chair that works well with my standing desk. It was easy to assemble. I needed a screwdriver for four screws. It is lightweight so I had no problem carrying it down the stairs either. I wish I would have gotten one with the arm rest soley because when you sit you're obviously higher in the air and I would prefer the comfort of arm rests. I plan on purchasing another one for my other desk with the arm rest feature.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Since I’m working from home due to the pandemic, I needed a comfortable chair at an affordable price. That is exactly what I got! Some people mention that the footstool is too high and pushes your knees up but not when the chair is raised up higher. I think those people added the extender with the footstool and expecting to use the chair in a low setting. The footstool works well when using at a counter height or higher. If using the chair for a lower desk, or table, just leave off the extender and footstool. Overall, I’m very happy with this chair !
customer_reviews.author: Mark Frymiare

customer_reviews.title: Using as a drafting stool for crafts.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of quality after some of the other reviews, but this arrived and was easy to assemble. It is the right height and pretty comfortable too. Although it will not be utilized on a daily basis, It seems to be holding up fine for two retirees.
customer_reviews.author: DB Cul

customer_reviews.title: Good looking, comfortable drafting/medical chair!
customer_reviews.text: NICE drafting/medical chair @ good price. Upholstered seat, ring for feet, adjustable back support, wheels. Instructions did not cover all aspects of assembly but fairly logical design. Chair is comfortable (without arms). Well packaged for shipment.
customer_reviews.author: Lady of the Foothills

customer_reviews.title: Fair price, okay product.
customer_reviews.text: Good chair that fits at the desk I have perfectly. It is surprising that you pay so much for chairs that have much lower quality than other pieces of furniture. The construction is plastic and is easily assembled. Maybe too easily, I can see after time some bits wearing out from use that may affect the sturdiness as time wears on. Such as the arms, the fabric, and the foot rest. Compared to other chairs on amazon the price is good. But, the product is just 'okay'.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Smith

customer_reviews.title: Glad this was nice and tall for my new stand ...
customer_reviews.text: Glad this was nice and tall for my new stand up desk. I was afraid it would be too low, it's not, I actually have to lower it a bit. ~~ Comfortable, suits my needs. Sometimes my feet get tired and I need to sit for a little while.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry C

customer_reviews.title: Chair will not stay up and the foot rest is too small to reach.
customer_reviews.text: I have only owned this chair for 12 hours and it will not stay up. It just goes down to the lowest setting every time. It is rated for 250 pounds and I weigh 200. The hydrologic simply does not work from day one. You can not use the foot rest it is too small for the seat size so your feet can not reach the foot rest unless you sit on the end of the seat. If you are leaned back using the back rest you will have to really stretch just to get your feet to touch the foot rest. You fill like you are going to fall out of the chair as it is leaning forward.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Miller

customer_reviews.title: great quality for the price and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I wish the back was a bit more adjustable ,but for the price I’m so happy with this chair. I have a stand up desk so the adjusting height stool chair was exactly what I needed. Definitely comfortable and good quality to me. I am 130 pound and 5’3 for reference.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: This is a great chair.. when you first get it.
customer_reviews.text: The chair is great when you first start using it. It's comfortable, give decent back support and is taller, which is exactly what I was looking for. I bought this is January and it's already falling apart. The bar that goes below your feet is pretty flimsy. It's already broken and if you are short do not depend on it to help you get on the chair. Wouldn't recommend buying of this is something you are going to use daily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not just for the office.
customer_reviews.text: Great in the kitchen! Perfect height for the counters & sink. If you have mobility problems, that chair could your solution. We used to use a rolling stool - no back. Found out real fast that it'll throw you. You really need the arm & back support.
customer_reviews.author: Griff Evans

customer_reviews.title: Good chair
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this as a chair for playing guitar. I needed back support and this chair is very comfortable. It does sit kind of high so it might not be the best for a desk as the lowest setting would be probably desk height with no room to go lower but I don't mind this for what I'm using it for. It was also easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: taco*boy

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair for my work desk and didn't want to spend a lot. It is exactly what you would expect and is an amazing value. The only improvement it needs is sturdy arms. The arms don't feel like they will come of but they do have too much flex to them.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed. Rolls smoothly even on carpet! Great product in this price point. Feels sturdy. The downside is the back accordion part of the chair, it feels like cheap plastic. Not the biggest deal unless you are particular about it. Also the fabric of the chair is slightly rough. Ehen wearing shorts, it feels like wool. Again, not a big deal I can just put a sheet over it if it bothers me too much. Fine when wearing longer pants! No need to spend over $200 for a drafting chair, this one is great and easy to put together!
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect this chair to last
customer_reviews.text: This chair lasted less than a year. Purchased in February for employees to use in a work environment (maybe 4 hours of actual sitting per day), and by December the stuffing was bulging out of the seat. Sure, it's not an expensive chair, but there are more durable options in the same price range. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, quick and easy to put together and well-priced
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, quick and easy to put together and well-priced. You will need a screwdriver, but the instructions are clear and simple. If I were to buy again, I think I would get one with arms. It also doesn't have much of anything in the way of lumbar support. However, it was exactly what I was expecting to get, and as it is, it works well. Great height adjustment, smooth rolling and well padded.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Barnett

customer_reviews.title: This was a great buy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this not expecting a lot for the price but it filled a need. I must say this is a pretty good product thus far. I had a small part broken during shipping. I called the number on the sheet inside and the customer support was really incredible. they shipped me out the part quickly with no issue. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Chair
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with this chair. The only reason I gave it four stars is due to the fact it doesn't lower quit enough. I purchased it to use in my kitchen so I could go from the counter to the stove and cabinets as I am handicapped. The height doesn't lower enough for my feet to reach the floor so I could glide.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Wrong measurement.
customer_reviews.text: I like the product but the seat is higher than in the specs. I saw that the chair went from 24-29 inches in the information. My chair only goes down to 26 1/2 inches where your butt sits and that is about 2 1/2 inches to high. Is there any way to make the chair go down to the 24 top of seat measurement?
customer_reviews.author: SALSA MAKERS

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2, not the same.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these. Purchased one last year. The new one arrived the other day and it's not the same chair. It's bigger, the seat, and it's too tall. It won't go down as far as the first one at 21". The farthest the new one goes down is 24". Too high for me to get into. Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Syd Wellman

customer_reviews.title: Ring is perfect to change the angle of your knees at a normal height desk. MUST add a thick tie on cushion.
customer_reviews.text: Does not go up very high and has very hard seat. Perfect if you need to be able to change the angle of your knees at a normal height desk and are willing to add a thick tie on cushion.
customer_reviews.author: C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not a horrible chair by any means
customer_reviews.text: Putting it together was relatively fast and easy - maybe 15 minutes. However I did wish i had a little more room in the seat itself. I am 6' and about 215 - and just wish the seat cushion was a little deeper and the back was a little higher. But overall the seat is great for the area I need it in.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy to Assemble and Comfy
customer_reviews.text: This as a very easy chair to set up. It can be raised up to be pretty higher, which is perfect to use when I need to take a break from my standing desk.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Wyllie

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drafting stool to use at a standing desk when I wanted to switch to seated for a while. I can't say it's comfortable for any length of time, so it does "encourage" returning to a standing position. For an adult, I'm not considered large, and the padding on the seat itself feels very limited. Maybe a couple more inches of foam along with a better slope/shape at the front edge of the seat would make this more comfortable; that is probably what I will try to avoid shelling out for another chair, but in hindsight I certainly would not have purchased this one!
customer_reviews.author: Anne Boleyn

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to assemble. U structions are not the right ones.
customer_reviews.text: After months and many tries to contact with the seller. My chair still in the box. No instructions and the instructions was provided is not enough to assemble the chair . I feel frustrated. Just send a brand new instructions ... please please
customer_reviews.author: Noeding’s Home

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: This chair was very easy to put together. Only took about 5 minutes! Like that it has a higher than normal seat elevation. I have a standing desk that I occasionally would like to sit at. This chair is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: BAS

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Update: downgrading ... can't sit for too long on this chair without feeling pain. Assembly is a bit tricky as there are no instructions for high chair model. For the price the chair is surprisingly robust and comfortable
customer_reviews.author: cchi

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I work a customer service job with counter height work space. There are no chairs for resting between customers. I could not continue standing all day in a non busy work environment. Problem solved! Great chair, great price!
customer_reviews.author: Zaria Crews

customer_reviews.title: High adjustable stool
customer_reviews.text: This is a bare bones adjustable task stool that works for a 42” bar height (29” seat). 5 stars for the price. It’s not heavy duty but this proven design has been around a long time. I use this in my garage work bench.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a sub $100 chair and you should expect nothing more
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's OK. But this is definitely budget office furniture. The back rest support assembly is cheaply designed, relying entirely upon a plastic plug which pulls out easily when adjusting it causing it to become very wobbly and useless. If you can deal with the cheap construction and anticipate it's design flaws, it's fine for a sub $100 chair. If you want a chair which you don't need to think about for 3 years then you need to aim higher.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon K Haws

customer_reviews.title: Can't even assemble it.
customer_reviews.text: It might be a nice chair to sit in, but I didn't receive any hardware for it to even assemble it. Also, the fabric feels extremely cheap for the price. Hugely disappointed; will be sending it right back.
customer_reviews.author: Jer Keene

customer_reviews.title: Seat of chair too high even at it's lowest setting
customer_reviews.text: I cannot get this chair to go low enough that I can sit at my desk it's too tall. I tried taking it apart and I can't take it apart to see if I can take a part off to get it to go lower. At it's lowest the seat is 25" off the floor which is too high to allow my legs to go under my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable.  Back broke off after 6 months...
customer_reviews.text: This chair is very uncomfortable. The back is stiff and pushes you forward. The seat is tiny and tips slightly to the left. The bolt holding the back on has broke off so now it's a seat without a back. Chair was fairly cheap so you get what you pay for. Splurge and get something more comfortable and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Jewels

customer_reviews.title: It's uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: The seat leans toward the front, which makes you feel like you're sliding off all the time, and the ring on the bottom broke almost immediately. So now, we have four, semi-lethal bars sticking out ready to amputate our feet at the ankle.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie h

customer_reviews.title: Good bargain price drafting-table height office chair.  Sturdy and easy to assemble.  Works as advertised.  Comfy upholstery.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and comfortable as-is for short periods of time. For longer sessions, I use a small footstool to support my feet as the angle to perch on the foot ring is uncomfortable after more than 30 minutes or so. This is likely a design issue for drafting-table height chairs generally and I do not think it's anything peculiar about the chair. Love being able to raise and lower the arms. I do wish it had more flex in the back, but that may be a safety issue and I would rather not have the ability to lean back -- than lean back and then wake up on the floor!
customer_reviews.author: Wallflower35223

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Durable, and Economical Chair!
customer_reviews.text: Great chair! Durable, professional-looking, and comfortable. The build directions aren't as specific as they could have been, and optional pegs to take the place of wheel bottoms would have been a nice touch. All in all, though, great product.
customer_reviews.author: L. Stevie P.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a petite person.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair for the height thinking I would need the extra inches as a drafting chair. I'm rather short and normal office chairs don't go high enough so that my arms fall at a proper angle on my desk. At first I put on the extension and it was too tall. The extension piece got stuck. With some WD-40, the extension came off and I was able to put the chair together without the extension. Excellent height. Perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: Julie-Ann Taniguchi

customer_reviews.title: I am not happy with this at all
customer_reviews.text: I just go this chair on 2/26 and already its failing. Just sitting down on it the cylinder starts to lose pressure and I slowly sink down. I am not happy with this at all. Fail within 72 hours of using this chair.
customer_reviews.author: WildBorego

product_meta.title: Boss Office Products Ergonomic Works Drafting Chair without Arms in Black
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style Name:No ArmsKeep employees productive with the Boss Drafting Stool B1615-BK with 20" chrome foot ring. The pneumatic gas lift seat-height adjustment lets users alter the height of the stool from 26.5 to 31.5". The ergonomically contoured seat, which is 17.5" W x 16.5" D, and back are upholstered in tweed fabric to withstand daily use, and the black 27" nylon base in a five-star format adds stability to the stool. Move the stool easily on hooded double-wheel casters. Weight capacity is 275 pounds and the overall size is 17.5" W x 25" D x 44.5 to 49.5" H.
feature_bullets: Contoured Back And Seat Help To Relieve Back-Strain; Pneumatic Gas Lift Seat Height Adjustment
Large 27" Nylon Base For Greater Stability; Hooded Double Wheel Casters
Optional Glides Can Be Used In Place Of Casters (Tu021)
Overall dimensions: 25”D x 25”W x 44. 5”– 49. 5”H; Weight capacity: 275 lbs.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,661 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
